polls.question: When conflict happens, what do you usually do first?

options.text: I try to talk it through immediately.
options.insightCopy: Speaking early can prevent resentment — just keep it kind.

options.text: I stay quiet and hope it passes.
options.insightCopy: Silence can feel safe, but it can also build distance. Try naming one feeling instead.

options.text: I withdraw to calm down first.
options.insightCopy: Taking space can be healthy — just make sure you return to the conversation.
Reactivity often hides hurt. A pause can protect your words and your home.

polls.defaultInsightCopy: Small shifts in how you respond during conflict can change the whole tone of your relationship.
